intro: Paeonia mascula proles lusitanica, commonly known as the Portuguese peony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring compound leaves with serrated edges. Its root system consists of thick, fleshy rhizomes that store nutrients and help the plant survive in various soil conditions. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
